result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher J. Dixon

records.addlTxt:
8:45 AM  This case was set for a hearing. Attorney Craig Michael Kuhary appeared by video for Christopher J. Dixon. Attorney Kuhary appeared by authorization for defendant. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane.  Attorney Kuhary advises the court that this case will be resolved by way of a county ordinance. The State agrees and advises that they have complied with victim rights

Prosecuting attorney moves to amend charge to a county ordinance contrary to section/ordinance 13-102(c)(8), Waukesha County Ordinances. Court approves amendment. No contest plea entered. 
 
The Court Orders the Following:	

$100 fine plus costs for a total of $330.50 to be paid within 90 days. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Filed by Atty. Kuhary requesting permission to appear by Zoom for the 11/4/2022 Hearing.  **Reviewed by Judge Dreyfus, for Branch 7, 11/3/22 - Ok.**

2:11 PM Attorney Craig Michael Kuhary in court for Christopher J. Dixon.  Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appears by authorization. 
Defense has received discovery and an offer and would like time to make a counter offer.
Hearing scheduled for November 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on November 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on October 5, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

11:24 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Chelsea Thompson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Craig Michael Kuhary in court for Christopher J. Dixon. Attorney appears by authorization. Atty. Kuhary provides an update, he is still missing some discovery and is still waiting on an offer from the State.  State advises there is an offer in the file and will send to defense counsel.  Atty. Kuhary requests a further proceedings date in about 45 days.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Authorization to appear received and filed.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Filed by Atty. Kuhary.
Filed by Atty. Kuhary on behalf of the defendant.

Adjustment Number: 22A 029221,
Payable Number: 470621,
Amount: $20.00
Hearing on August 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster once received by the Court.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.

03:14 PM Defendant Christopher J. Dixon in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Defendant states he posted cash bail on this case in Milwaukee County which the Court has not yet received this money.  Hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Christopher J. Dixon
Current: 950 S 61st St, West Allis, WI 53214 United States  (Effective: 07-06-2022)
Prior: 6230 39Th Ave, Kenosha, WI 53142
7/2/22 - Bond posted @ Milwaukee County sheriff.
EXT CODE 3.

11:35 AM Defendant Christopher J. Dixon not in court.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

State motions the Court to issue a warrant for the defendant.
The Court will issue a $500.00 arrest warrant.

To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key.
